solution_line_template: In the second anthill, there are {percentage_fewer} * {first_anthill_ants} = <<{percentage_fewer}*{first_anthill_ants}={ants_less_second_anthill}>>{ants_less_second_anthill} ants less.
This means there are {first_anthill_ants} - {ants_less_second_anthill} = <<{first_anthill_ants}-{ants_less_second_anthill}={second_anthill_ants}>>{second_anthill_ants} ants in the second anthill.

In the third anthill, there are {percentage_fewer} * {second_anthill_ants} = <<{percentage_fewer}*{second_anthill_ants}={ants_less_third_anthill}>>{ants_less_third_anthill} ants less compared to the second one.
So in the third anthill, there are {second_anthill_ants} - {ants_less_third_anthill} = <<{second_anthill_ants}-{ants_less_third_anthill}={third_anthill_ants}>>{third_anthill_ants} ants.
